q_en: Which cutting tasks use Cotton Fabric?
gt:
Sure thing! Here are the cutting tasks that use **Cotton Fabric** as a material. I've organized the details into a neat table for you. üòä

| Cutting Task ID | Start Time     | End Time       | Working Group ID | Order Product ID | Produced WIP ID | Planned Number | Completed Number | Status     |
|-----------------|----------------|----------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------|----------------|------------------|------------|
| 1               | January 10, 2024 | January 18, 2024 | 2                | 1                | 2               | 100            | 100              | Completed  |
| 2               | January 10, 2024 | February 2, 2024 | 3                | 2                | 10              | 240            | 240              | In Progress|
| 3               | January 10, 2024 | January 19, 2024 | 3                | 3                | 2               | 150            | 150              | Completed  |
| 4               | January 10, 2024 | January 17, 2024 | 2                | 4                | 4               | 220            | 220              | In Progress|
| 5               | January 10, 2024 | February 2, 2024 | 2                | 5                | 8               | 260            | 260              | In Progress|
| 19              | March 18, 2024   | April 12, 2024   | 4                | 19               | 6               | 95             | 95               | In Progress|
| 21              | March 18, 2024   | April 4, 2024    | 4                | 21               | 10              | 85             | 85               | In Progress|
| 28              | April 19, 2024   | May 12, 2024     | 2                | 28               | 4               | 210            | 210              | In Progress|

The status values indicate the progress of the task, where "In Progress" might represent ongoing tasks and "Completed" represents finished tasks. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòÑ

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM materials WHERE name = 'Cotton Fabric';
steps.description: Retrieve the material ID for the material with the name "Cotton Fabric"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM warehouse_material WHERE material_id = '1';
steps.description: Retrieve the warehouse material ID for the material "Cotton Fabric"

steps.sql: SELECT cutting_task_id FROM cutting_material_allocation WHERE warehouse_material_id = '1' AND is_allocated = 1;
steps.description: Retrieve the cutting task IDs that use the warehouse material "Cotton Fabric"

results.input:
Retrieve the details of the cutting tasks using the IDs obtained in Step 3
["tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 1}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 2}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 3}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 4}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 5}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 19}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 21}, Find the cutting task details", "tool_find_cutting_task, {'cutting_task_id': 28}, Find the cutting task details"]
